ASE2025repos/ase-boose-assignment-Rah140.title: ASE semester 1 2025 Portfolio | BOOSE Documentation
ASE2025repos/ase-boose-assignment-Rah140.summary: ASE semester 1 2025 Portfolio Basic Object Orientated Software Engineering (BOOSE). Fill in the fields below. Muhammed Raheem Ali Your Group Each element is covered in the weekly sessions, using the BOOSE library source code as an example. I will discuss how I implemented the more difficult elements (like the parser, implementing loops etc.) Keep your progress up to date below. Put "DONE" after each section, when you have done it. The number in brackets represents the component that each element contributes to. Checkpoint 1 Version Control (1) At least two documented commits to provided on GitHub Classroom BEFORE 12pm 7th October. At least 5 documented commits. Readme.md file filled in correctly. 2 Unit Tests for basic drawing commands above (1) Unit Test for moveto command (variables storing pen position are correct) Unit Test for drawTo command (variables storing pen position are correct) Unit Test for a multiline program. 3 XML Comments/documentation produced (1) Fully documented with XML comments and Documentation web site produced 4 Exception Handling (1) 5 Library (DLL) installed and working with reasonable user interface (2) Form interface with program window, output window and run button BOOSE DLL library installed call about method and display returned information in output/debug window you can use System.Diagnostics to output to the debug window 6 Basic drawing commands of the library are implemented (2) Moveto, circle, rect, pencolour, write. Unrestricted drawing programs can be run (1unrestrictedDrawing.boose) You MUST fill in the this form before submission and submit your zipped up project to myBeckett Read the hand in instructions on myBeckett carefully to ensure you are submitting everything correctly, as if you don't you may be subject to a penalty. Final Submission 1 Further Version Control (1) You must continue to use VC to a professional standard with frequent and clear commits Your Readme.md must be up to date 2 Use of Interfaces (1) Interfaces to be used for all classes where appropriate 3 Further Unit Testing (1) Tests for full program all of the facilities completed in 5,6 and 7 below It is up to you how design your tests (i.e. one test per facility or one test testing many but they must be clearly documented with XML comments) 4 Design Patterns (1) Use of factory Design Pattern for command creation Use of Singleton Design Pattern Demonstrate the use of another design pattern of your choice (for 5,6 and 7 you can click the links to see the example BOOSE programs that must be run, these are in your Portfolio. You must run the unrestricted programs and replace the image already there with an image of your BOOSE Interpreter running the BOOSE programs. You may show further programs in your portfolio.) 5 Replaced variables (2) * Int Real Array 6 Replaced if, while, for (2) * While For If else 7 Replaced Methods (2) * 8 Additional (web version, text-based version, extension to BOOSE itself, etc, discuss with your tutor) (2) * You must rewrite the functionality and not try and "hack the system". I've tried to make it so you can't but who knows, either way, you've been told. You MUST fill in this form whilst recording your YouTube Video AND submit it to myBeckett Read the hand in instructions on myBeckett carefully to ensure you are submitting everything correctly, as if you don't you may be subject to a penalty. Links These are for convinience. Check on myBeckett in the Assessment directory for any up to date links. BOOSE Documentation BOOSE DLL Download Assignment Specification - including all university details Detailed Assignment Information - with marking scheme Assignment Help Videos Remember that BOOSE.DLL maybe updated, as it may have bugs in it, or new features may be added. Keep updated on Discord and make sure you always have the latest version in your project. V1.0

README.html.summary: ASE semester 1 2025 Portfolio Basic Object Orientated Software Engineering (BOOSE). Fill in the fields below. Muhammed Raheem Ali Your Group Each element is covered in the weekly sessions, using the BOOSE library source code as an example. I will discuss how I implemented the more difficult elements (like the parser, implementing loops etc.) Keep your progress up to date below. Put "DONE" after each section, when you have done it. The number in brackets represents the component that each element contributes to. Checkpoint 1 Version Control (1) At least two documented commits to provided on GitHub Classroom BEFORE 12pm 7th October. At least 5 documented commits. Unrestricted drawing programs can be run (1unrestrictedDrawing.boose) You MUST fill in the this form before submission and submit your zipped up project to myBeckett Read the hand in instructions on myBeckett carefully to ensure you are submitting everything correctly, as if you don't you may be subject to a penalty. Final Submission 1 Further Version Control (1) You must continue to use VC to a professional standard with frequent and clear commits Your Readme.md must be up to date 2 Use of Interfaces (1) Interfaces to be used for all classes where appropriate 3 Further Unit Testing (1) Tests for full program all of the facilities completed in 5,6 and 7 below It is up to you how design your tests (i.e. one test per facility or one test testing many but they must be clearly documented with XML comments) 4 Design Patterns (1) Use of factory Design Pattern for command creation Use of Singleton Design Pattern Demonstrate the use of another design pattern of your choice (for 5,6 and 7 you can click the links to see the example BOOSE programs that must be run, these are in your Portfolio. You must run the unrestricted programs and replace the image already there with an image of your BOOSE Interpreter running the BOOSE programs. You may show further programs in your portfolio.) 5 Replaced variables (2) * Int Real Array 6 Replaced if, while, for (2) * While For If else 7 Replaced Methods (2) * 8 Additional (web version, text-based version, extension to BOOSE itself, etc, discuss with your tutor) (2) * You must rewrite the functionality and not try and "hack the system". api/BOOSEcode2.MyCanvas.html.title: Class MyCanvas | BOOSE Documentation
api/BOOSEcode2.MyCanvas.html.summary: Class MyCanvas Namespace BOOSEcode2 Assembly BOOSEcode2.dll A simple canvas used by the BOOSE interpreter. Handles drawing shapes, lines, colours and text. public class MyCanvas : ICanvas Inheritance object MyCanvas Implements ICanvas Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors MyCanvas(int, int) Creates a new canvas with the given size. public MyCanvas(int xsize, int ysize) Parameters xsize int The width of the canvas in pixels ysize int The height of the canvas in pixels Properties PenColour Not implemented. Use SetColour method instead. public object PenColour { get; set; } Property Value object Exceptions NotImplementedException This property is not supported Xpos Current X position of the drawing cursor. public int Xpos { get; set; } Property Value int Ypos Current Y position of the drawing cursor. public int Ypos { get; set; } Property Value int Methods Circle(int, bool) Draws a circle with the cursor as the centre point. public void Circle(int radius, bool filled) Parameters radius int The radius of the circle in pixels filled bool Whether the circle should be filled (not currently implemented) Clear() Clears the canvas to white. public void Clear() DrawTo(int, int) Draws a line from the cursor to a new point, then moves the cursor. public void DrawTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The target X coordinate y int The target Y coordinate MoveTo(int, int) Moves the cursor without drawing. public void MoveTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The target X coordinate y int The target Y coordinate Rect(int, int, bool) Draws an unfilled rectangle. public void Rect(int width, int height, bool filled) Parameters width int The width of the rectangle in pixels height int The height of the rectangle in pixels filled bool Whether to fill the rectangle (not currently implemented) Reset() Resets the cursor back to 0,0. public void Reset() Set(int, int) Creates a new blank canvas with the given size. public void Set(int width, int height) Parameters width int The width of the new canvas in pixels height int The height of the new canvas in pixels SetColour(int, int, int) Sets the pen colour using RGB values. public void SetColour(int red, int green, int blue) Parameters red int Red component (0-255) green int Green component (0-255) blue int Blue component (0-255) Tri(int, int) Draws a right-angled triangle. public void Tri(int width, int height) Parameters width int The width of the triangle base in pixels height int The height of the triangle in pixels WriteText(string) Draws text at the current cursor position. public void WriteText(string text) Parameters text string The text string to draw on the canvas getBitmap() Returns the canvas bitmap. public object getBitmap() Returns object The Bitmap object representing the canvas
